## AST.selectRandomNode() method

Returns random [ASTNode](./gp.astnode.md) from given tree, using the user provided PRNG (via `opts`<!-- -->) or [SYSTEM](./random.system.md)<!-- -->. The returned value is a [zipper location](./zipper.location.md) of the selected node.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
selectRandomNode(tree: ASTNode<OP, T>, min?: number, max?: number): Location<ASTNode<OP, T>>;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  tree | <code>ASTNode&lt;OP, T&gt;</code> |  |
|  min | <code>number</code> |  |
|  max | <code>number</code> |  |

<b>Returns:</b>

`Location<ASTNode<OP, T>>`

## Remarks

The actual `ASTNode` can be obtained via `.node`<!-- -->.

Only nodes in the linearized index range `[min..max)` are returned (default: entire tree range). Since the linear tree length isn't known beforehand, `max` &lt; 0 (default) is equivalent to the linearized tree end.
